Store

La Filmothèque Store

Welcome to La Filmothèque Store! Here you can buy classic films on DVD and Blu-ray recommended by La Filmothèque. By shopping on the store you get a chance to support our website as well as the industry around classic cinema, thus helping spread the word that these films alive and kicking!

Recommended items

DVD & Bluray

Box sets

The Ultimate Buster Keaton Collection (Blu-ray)

Rating:
★ ★ ★ ★ ★

Released by Kino Classics, boxed set includes all Buster Keaton Kino Classic Ultimate Collections. Set consists of Ultimate Edition releases of Keaton's 1920-1923 short films, The Saphead, Our Hospitality, Sherlock Jr, and many others. Set has been repackaged to save space with up to four discs in four plastic cases and a slip case. Upgrades range from major restoration to sharper images from past releases.

Buy on Amazon:  $149.99

Ministry of Fear (Blu-ray)

Rating:
★ ★ ★ ★ ★

Fritz Lang's adaptation of Graham Greene's novel drags viewers into the shadows of a world torn apart by war in which a man finds himself caught up in the dark underworld of a seemingly peaceful village with possible Nazi connections. An artful 2K digital restoration featuring new interview with Fritz Lang scholar, Joe McElhaney.

Buy on Amazon:  $19.69

All That Heaven Allows (Blu-ray + DVD)

Rating:
★ ★ ★ ★ ★

Rock Hudson stars as a treesurgeon whose much older, wealthier girlfriend finds herself under scrutiny by her children and friends, and faces the decision to continue or terminate the relationship. Digitally restored. Includes Rock Hudson's Home Movies, a French television interview with director Douglas Sirk, and documentaries featuring rare interview footage.

Buy on Amazon:  $27.17

Brief Encounter (Blu-ray)

Rating:
★ ★ ★ ★ ★

The passionate yet doomed love affair of a married doctor and a suburban housewife after a chance meeting on a train platform in Britain unfolds in David Lean's tragic romance. Beautiful high-definition digital transfer of the BFI National Archive's 2008 restoration features short documentary on making of the film and 1971 documentary on director's career.

Buy on Amazon:  $26.19

Speedy (Blu-ray)

Rating:
★ ★ ★ ★ ★

Slapstick icon Harold Lloyd reprises his Glasses Character in his last silent film. A good-natured yet scatterbrained New York man finds his calling when he determines to save the city's last horse-drawn streetcar. Criterion Collection has outdone itself with this 4K digital restoration utilizing elements preserved by the UCLA Film and Television Archive.

Buy on Amazon:  $26.55

Tokyo Story (Blu-ray)

Rating:
★ ★ ★ ★ ★

Yasujiro Ozu's crowning achievement offers an evocative look into elemental humanity and universal heartbreak through an aging couple's journey to visit their grown children in postwar Tokyo. A poignant restoration using digital 4K film, transfer, featuring new English subtitle translation and interviews with former cast and crew members, and a forty-minute tribute to the legendary director.

Buy on Amazon:  $27.99

Seven Samurai (Blu-ray)

Rating:
★ ★ ★ ★ ★

A stunning high-definition restoration of Akira Kurosawa's 1954 classic story of a small Japanese village seeking protection from a band of thieves by paying handfuls of rice to seven Samurais. Includes a documentary on the making-of the film, an interview with the legendary Kurosawa, and "Seven Samurai: Origins and Influences" documentary. A gallery of rare posters and behind-the-scenes and production stills complete the experience of this classic film.

Buy on Amazon:  $28.49

Foreign Correspondent (Blu-ray + DVD)

Rating:
★ ★ ★ ★ ★

One of Alfred Hitchcock's first American movies following his transition from British film industry. Espionage thriller detailing a Yank reporter sent to Europe to get the scoop on the impending war, filled with witty repartee, plot twists, and suspense. Digitally restored, features new piece on visual affects and an interview with director Alfred Hitchcock.

Buy on Amazon:  $35.97

Faust (Blu-ray + DVD)

Rating:
★ ★ ★ ★ ★

Special edition meticulous HD restoration of F.W. Murnau's adaptation of the classic story of the titular alchemist who struggles with his faith in the aftermath of devastating plague and trades his soul for the power to cure and the gift of youth. Features documentary on making of the film and its subsequent restoration, screen test footage of abandoned production Marguerite and Faust.

Buy on Amazon:  $22.19

The Apu Trilogy (DVD)

Rating:
★ ★ ★ ★ ★

Meticulously reconstructed two decades after original negatives burned in a fire. Satyajit Ray's milestone of film brought India into the Golden Age of international art-house films. Follows a free-spirited Bengali child who grows into an adolescent urban student and finally a sensitive, worldly man. Features new program on restorations by filmmaker.

Buy on Amazon:  $64.00

Essential Art House - 50 Years of Janus Films (DVD)

Rating:
★ ★ ★ ★ ★

A 50 disc celebration of international films collected under Janus Films, the groundbreaking theatrical distributor. Languages include English, French, and Russian. Sold in two volume set, one contains the DVDs, while the other contains a 200 page hardback book overflowing with essays and introductions of each film in the set. Includes films from iconic directors Ingmar Bergman and Akira Kurosawa.

Buy on Amazon:  $549.33

City Lights (Blu-ray + DVD)

Rating:
★ ★ ★ ★ ★

Charlie Chaplin's most cherished film, the ultimate Little Tramp chronicle in which the iconic vagrant falls for a blind young flower seller who mistakes him for a millionaire. Made after the dawn of sound films, this Depression-era hit became the crowning achievement of silent film. Beautiful 4K film transfer digital restoration features archival production footage and excerpt from Chaplin's 1915 short, The Champion.

Buy on Amazon:  $39.95

Georges Melies: First Wizard of Cinema 1896-1913 (DVD)

Rating:
★ ★ ★ ★ ★

Painstakingly gathered by Eric Lange and David Shepard, including 1896 first Partie de Cartes down to Melies final film in 1913, Voyage de la Famille Bourrichone. Georges Melies is regarded as wizard of modern film making who set the pace for future films and film makers. Features introductory film Melies widow who performed in many of Melies films and Andre Milies portraying his father, Georges.

Buy on Amazon:  $69.05

The Seventh Seal (Blu-ray)

Rating:
★ ★ ★ ★ ★

Ingmar Bergman's masterfully symbolic film depicts man's search for life's meaning as a disenchanted knight returns to his homeland from the Crusades. On the sands of a desolate beach, he challenges Death to an ominous chess match. With an introduction by Bergman himself recorded in 2003, this digitally restored classic is a must-have for any film connoisseur.

Buy on Amazon:  $26.05

All That Heaven Allows (Blu-ray + DVD)

Rating:
★ ★ ★ ★ ★

Rock Hudson stars as a treesurgeon whose much older, wealthier girlfriend finds herself under scrutiny by her children and friends, and faces the decision to continue or terminate the relationship. Digitally restored. Includes Rock Hudson's Home Movies, a French television interview with director Douglas Sirk, and documentaries featuring rare interview footage.

Buy on Amazon:  $27.17

Rating:
★ ★ ★ ★ ★

Buy on Amazon:  $39.95

Rating:
★ ★ ★ ★ ★

Georges Melies is regarded as wizard of modern film making who set the pace for future films and film makers. Features introductory film Melies widow who performed in many of Melies films and Andre Milies portraying his father, Georges.

Buy on Amazon:  $69.05

Written on the Wind (DVD)

Rating:
★ ★ ★ ★ ★

Enhanced for 16x9 televisions, this gorgeous technicolor classic starring Rock Hudson, Lauren Bacall, and Robert Stack depicts the debauched story of a Texas oil magnate struck down by his spoiled children. Features an annotated filmography of director Douglas Sirk with behind-the-scenes and production photos and vintage lobby cards.

Buy on Amazon:  $22.19

Foreign Correspondent (Blu-ray + DVD)

Rating:
★ ★ ★ ★ ★

One of Alfred Hitchcock's first American movies following his transition from British film industry. Espionage thriller detailing a Yank reporter sent to Europe to get the scoop on the impending war, filled with witty repartee, plot twists, and suspense. Digitally restored, features new piece on visual affects and an interview with director Alfred Hitchcock.

Buy on Amazon:  $35.97

Ikiru (Blu-ray)

Rating:
★ ★ ★ ★ ★

An affirmation of life through an exploration of death, Akira Kirosawa's Ikiru is among his greatest directorial achievements. A two-part portrayal of the end days of bureaucrat Kanji Wantanabe as he battles stomach cancer and learns to find meaning as his life comes to a close. Blu ray features ninety minute documentary A Message from Akira Kirosawa.

Buy on Amazon:  $27.04

The Gold Rush (Blu-ray)

Rating:
★ ★ ★ ★ ★

A stunning restoration of Charlie Chaplin's comedic classic which endeared his Tramp character for generations. A prospector's search for gold in the Klondikes leads to the discovery of romance. Special edition includes Chaplin's ultimate 1942 version, for which he added new music and narration, and a new restoration of the 1925 original.

Buy on Amazon:  $27.99

Ministry of Fear (Blu-ray)

Rating:
★ ★ ★ ★ ★

Fritz Lang's adaptation of Graham Greene's novel drags viewers into the shadows of a world torn apart by war in which a man finds himself caught up in the dark underworld of a seemingly peaceful village with possible Nazi connections. An artful 2K digital restoration featuring new interview with Fritz Lang scholar, Joe McElhaney.

Buy on Amazon:  $19.69

Tokyo Story (Blu-ray)

Rating:
★ ★ ★ ★ ★

Yasujiro Ozu's crowning achievement offers an evocative look into elemental humanity and universal heartbreak through an aging couple's journey to visit their grown children in postwar Tokyo. A poignant restoration using digital 4K film, transfer, featuring new English subtitle translation and interviews with former cast and crew members, and a forty-minute tribute to the legendary director.

Buy on Amazon:  $27.99

Metropolis (Blu-ray)

Rating:
★ ★ ★ ★ ★

The Murnau Foundation restoration of Fritz Lang's legendary science fiction epic offers crisp, vibrant images, with composite sequences restored to their original illusory glory. With a populace divided between underground-dwelling workers and the splendid futuristic city peopled by the wealthy, the knife-edge balance of the two societies is beautifully illustrated through now-iconic imagery.

Buy on Amazon:  $25.29

Speedy (Blu-ray)

Rating:
★ ★ ★ ★ ★

Slapstick icon Harold Lloyd reprises his Glasses Character in his last silent film. A good-natured yet scatterbrained New York man finds his calling when he determines to save the city's last horse-drawn streetcar. Criterion Collection has outdone itself with this 4K digital restoration utilizing elements preserved by the UCLA Film and Television Archive.

Buy on Amazon:  $26.55

M (Blu-ray)

Rating:
★ ★ ★ ★ ★

An evocative, off-screen whistle signals the impending death of young Elsie Beckman at the hands of serial killer Hans Beckert in Fritz Lang's chilling 1931 masterpiece. Blu-ray includes long lost English language version, from nitrate print preserved by the British Film Institute, plus three contemporary news articles and the script from a missing scene.

Buy on Amazon:  $26.84

Brief Encounter (Blu-ray)

Rating:
★ ★ ★ ★ ★

The passionate yet doomed love affair of a married doctor and a suburban housewife after a chance meeting on a train platform in Britain unfolds in David Lean's tragic romance. Beautiful high-definition digital transfer of the BFI National Archive's 2008 restoration features short documentary on making of the film and 1971 documentary on director's career.

Buy on Amazon:  $26.19

Seven Samurai (Blu-ray)

Rating:
★ ★ ★ ★ ★

A stunning high-definition restoration of Akira Kurosawa's 1954 classic story of a small Japanese village seeking protection from a band of thieves by paying handfuls of rice to seven Samurais. Includes a documentary on the making-of the film, an interview with the legendary Kurosawa, and "Seven Samurai: Origins and Influences" documentary. A gallery of rare posters and behind-the-scenes and production stills complete the experience of this classic film.

Buy on Amazon:  $28.49

The General (Blu-ray)

Rating:
★ ★ ★ ★ ★

Ranked at number eighteen of the American Film Institute's Top 100, this Buster Keaton classic has been mastered from a 35 mm archive print struck from the original camera negative. Taken for a coward by the woman he loves after being judged unfit and summarily rejected by the Confederate Army, young Johnny Gray hopes to redeem himself when Yankee spies steal his cherished locomotive.

Buy on Amazon:  $22.19

Rashomon (Blu-ray)

Rating:
★ ★ ★ ★ ★

Akira Kurosawa presents the story of a man's murder and his wife's rape in this 1950 psychological thriller through the eyes of four different people, using striking imagery and ingenious flashback sequences. Criterion Collection has truly rendered a masterful restoration with this revolutionary film. Includes booklet featuring reprints of Rashomon's source stories by Ryunosuke Akutagawa.

Buy on Amazon:  $25.39

Diary of a Lost Girl (Blu-ray)

Rating:
★ ★ ★ ★ ★

Digitally remastered and restored from 35 mm archival film elements, second and final collaboration of Louise Brooks and director G.W. Pabst. After being seduced by her pharmacist father's assistant, a pregnant teen is disowned and sent to a home for wayward girls. Searching for her child after escaping the home, she turns the tables on the society which had been so cruel to her.

Buy on Amazon:  $15.02

Come & See (DVD)

Rating:
★ ★ ★ ★ ★

Deafened by German artillery after being separated from his comrades in war-torn World War II USSR, Florya and a beguiling peasant girl see the devastation of war up close as they trek through battle-scarred Russian forests. Restoration available in German and Russian with English subtitles offered.

Buy on Amazon:  $21.06

Faust (Blu-ray + DVD)

Rating:
★ ★ ★ ★ ★

Special edition meticulous HD restoration of F.W. Murnau's adaptation of the classic story of the titular alchemist who struggles with his faith in the aftermath of devastating plague and trades his soul for the power to cure and the gift of youth. Features documentary on making of the film and its subsequent restoration, screen test footage of abandoned production Marguerite and Faust.

Buy on Amazon:  $22.19

Paths of Glory (Blu-ray)

Rating:
★ ★ ★ ★ ★

Kirk Douglas stars in Stanley Kubrick's powerful antiwar film as a World War I French Colonel who faces off with army top brass when his men are accused of cowardice when their impossible mission fails. High definition digital transfer made from 35 mm film elements restored by UCLA Film and Television Archive.

Buy on Amazon:  $26.19

The Wages Of Fear (Blu-ray)

Rating:
★ ★ ★ ★ ★

Desperation leads four men in a grimy South American oil town to sign on for a suicide mission driving nitroglycerin-loaded trucks over a dangerous mountain route, a move which tests their courage, friendship, and nerves with each bump on the path. Blu-ray includes interviews with assistant director and biographer. Stunning high-definition digital restoration of French master of suspense's timeless work.

Buy on Amazon:  $26.19

Only Angels Have Wings (Blu-ray)

Rating:
★ ★ ★ ★ ★

Digitally restored 1939 action classic stars Jean Arthur as a traveling entertainer who meets a handsome air mailman, played by legendary actor Carey Grant, during a stopover in a South American port. Movie follows their romance as Arthur's character stays on in the town, amid the objections of Grant's gruff character. Features new interview with film critic David Thomson and audio from 1972 conversation between filmmakers Howard Hawks and Peter Bogdanovich.

Buy on Amazon:  $26.19

Sansho the Bailiff (Blu-ray)

Rating:
★ ★ ★ ★ ★

An idealistic governor is cast into exile when he disobeys the reigning feudal lord, leaving his wife and children to fend themselves until they are wrenched from one another by vicious slave traders. Blu-ray features two versions of the story which created the basis of the film. A breathtaking restoration complete with English subtitles and audio commentary by Japanese-literature scholar Jeffrey Angles.

Buy on Amazon:  $27.30

The Kid (DVD)

Rating:
★ ★ ★ ★ ★

A treasured gem of the silent film era, Charlie Chaplin's first foray into full-length features displays his lovable Tramp character raising an orphan rescued from the streets. Digitally restored from 1972 rerelease version, featuring Chaplin's own original musical score and deleted scenes and titles from original 1921 release. Rare footage of Chaplin conducting score included.

Buy on Amazon:  $19.69

To Be or Not to Be (Blu-ray)

Rating:
★ ★ ★ ★ ★

Classic black comedy following husband-and-wife thespians in Nazi-occupied Warsaw caught up in a dangerous spy plot. Featuring new auditory commentary by film historian David Kalat, two episodes of radio anthology series Screen Guild Theater, and booklet featuring essay by critic Geoffrey O'Brien. Restored 2K digital film transfer, with uncompressed monaural soundtrack on the Blu-ray edition.

Buy on Amazon:  $25.99

Battleship Potemkin (Blu-ray)

Rating:
★ ★ ★ ★ ★

Artfully restored, Battleship Potemkin tells the story of the 1905 rebellion aboard the titular ship thanks to deplorable conditions. The revolt becomes the rallying point for the common people of Russia against the Czar and his Cossacks. Features a documentary on the making and restoration of the influential classic, with newly-translated English intertitles while preserving the original Russian intertitles.

Buy on Amazon:  $18.84

The Blue Angel (Blu-ray)

Rating:
★ ★ ★ ★ ★

Impeccable tale of a sexually-repressed professor at an all-boys' school who investigates the indecency spreading through the school, stemming from the pupils' obsession with French postcards depicting a local nightclub entertainer and finds himself falling from respectability upon meeting the seductive nightingale. Restoration available in both German and English, with English subtitles featured in the German version.

Buy on Amazon:  $27.99

In a Lonely Place (Blu-ray)

Rating:
★ ★ ★ ★ ★

Nicholas Ray's suspense thriller starring Humphrey Bogart as a washed-up, short tempered screenwriter who becomes the prime suspect in a Tinseltown murder, his only hope an alibi supplied by his troubled, seductive neighbor. Criterion Collection has artfully restored this 1950 classic, using 2K digital restoration with uncompressed monaural soundtrack. Includes radio adaptation from 1948 of film's inspiration, novel by Dorothy B. Hughes.

Buy on Amazon:  $27.99

Woman in the Moon (Blu-ray)

Rating:
★ ★ ★ ★ ★

Fritz Lang teamed up with screenwriter Thea von Harbou and a team of technical consultants to produce this ambitious dramatization of the first lunar expedition, complete with romance and espionage. Considered one of the first serious science fiction films, following a group of passengers on a spaceship to the moon to test if the atmosphere can sustain human life. Gorgeous 2K restoration features piano score by Javier Pérez de Azpeitia. German language with English subtitles.

Buy on Amazon:  $14.95

The Apu Trilogy (DVD)

Rating:
★ ★ ★ ★ ★

Meticulously reconstructed two decades after original negatives burned in a fire. Satyajit Ray's milestone of film brought India into the Golden Age of international art-house films. Follows a free-spirited Bengali child who grows into an adolescent urban student and finally a sensitive, worldly man. Features new program on restorations by filmmaker.

Buy on Amazon:  $64.00

Carl Theodor Dreyer (DVD)

Rating:
★ ★ ★ ★ ★

A compelling collection of director Carl Theodor Dreyer's sound films, Day of Wrath, Ordet, and Gertrud. New digital transfers supervised by Gertrud director of photography Henning Bendtsen, these films are being released on DVD for the first time. Each DVD features extra interview footage, with the fourth DVD featuring archival footage.

Buy on Amazon:  $58.99

Late Ozu (DVD)

Rating:
★ ★ ★ ★ ★

Five subtle family dramas notable by an ethereal elegance and emotional sensitivity touching on such events as birth and death, love and marriage, and the joys and loneliness that accompany the various stages of life. Exquisitely restored and released in Japanese with English subtitles. These works illustrate filmmaker Yasujiro Ozu's talent and worldly wisdom at the height of his influence.

Buy on Amazon:  $47.89

The Complete Jacques Tati (Blu-ray)

Rating:
★ ★ ★ ★ ★

Seven disc collection features new digital restorations of all six feature films and all seven shorts. Contains two alternate versions of Jour de Fete, including a fully colorized 1994 rerelease. Additional features consist of archival interviews, visual essays, selected-scene commentaries, and English subtitle translations.

Buy on Amazon:  $73.09

Georges Melies: First Wizard of Cinema 1896-1913 (DVD)

Rating:
★ ★ ★ ★ ★

Painstakingly gathered by Eric Lange and David Shepard, including 1896 first Partie de Cartes down to Melies final film in 1913, Voyage de la Famille Bourrichone. Georges Melies is regarded as wizard of modern film making who set the pace for future films and film makers. Features introductory film Melies widow who performed in many of Melies films and Andre Milies portraying his father, Georges.

Buy on Amazon:  $69.05

Murnau Collection (DVD)

Rating:
★ ★ ★ ★ ★

Celebrated director F.W. Murnau's six classic films, Nosferatu, Faust, The Last Laugh, Tartuffe, The Haunted Castle, and The Finances of the Grand Duke. Released in newly restored editions, Nosferatu, Faust, and The Last Laugh include lost screen test footage, scene comparisons, photo galleries, and making-of documentary. Authorized restoration editions of Tartuffe, The Haunted Castle, and The Finances of the Grand Duke are also included in the collection.

Buy on Amazon:  $58.77

The Complete Jean Vigo (Blu-ray)

Rating:
★ ★ ★ ★ ★

Set features all four of Jean Vigo's films, shot before his untimely death at age 29. Son of an anarchist, Vigo's films defied all conventional rules of film making at the time. Features high definition digital restorations of all films, alternate shots, an animated tribute to Vigo. One silent film, three featuring French language with English subtitles.

Buy on Amazon:  $26.05

Twin Peaks - The Entire Mystery (Blu-ray)

Rating:
★ ★ ★ ★ ★

In dazzling high definition, this comprehensive collection of the television series includes both the US and international versions of the show's pilot, the North American Blu-ray debut of the follow-up feature Twin Peaks: Fire Walk With Me, and 90 minutes of deleted and alternate scenes from the film. Also features newly transferred introductions to each episode, and a new featurette with director and series stars depicting their characters today.

Buy on Amazon:  $74.88

Kenji Mizoguchi's Fallen Women (DVD)

Rating:
★ ★ ★ ★ ★

In these four biting social commentaries on the plight of women in Japanese society, Kenji Mizoguchi brings to life four compelling female protagonists who are forced by their culture into compromising positions. Criterion Collection has outdone itself in restoring and releasing these masterpieces of social commentary. Released in Japanese featuring English subtitles.

Buy on Amazon:  $40.06

Essential Art House - 50 Years of Janus Films (DVD)

Rating:
★ ★ ★ ★ ★

A 50 disc celebration of international films collected under Janus Films, the groundbreaking theatrical distributor. Languages include English, French, and Russian. Sold in two volume set, one contains the DVDs, while the other contains a 200 page hardback book overflowing with essays and introductions of each film in the set. Includes films from iconic directors Ingmar Bergman and Akira Kurosawa.

Buy on Amazon:  $549.33

Eisenstein: The Sound Years (DVD)

Rating:
★ ★ ★ ★ ★

Film art pioneer Sergei Eisenstein collection featuring both parts to the icon's Ivan the Terrible and Alexander Nevsky. After visiting Hollywood and Mexico, Eisenstein abandoned former densely edited style of popular silent films and turned instead to historical sources. New transfer with extensive digital restoration of sound and image, featuring deleted scenes, sketches and storyboards, multimedia essays, English subtitle translations.

Buy on Amazon:  $68.11

The Ingmar Bergman Trilogy (DVD)

Rating:
★ ★ ★ ★ ★

Ingmar Bergman's chamber dramas examine faith and alienation in the modern age utilizing minimal dialogue, eerily isolated settings, and chilling performances by Bergman's cast of stars. High definition digital transfer of all films with restored image and sound. Includes Through a Glass Darkly, Winter Light, The Silence, essays by film scholars, and video discussions with Bergman biographer Peter Cowie.

Buy on Amazon:  $53.58

Buster Keaton: The Shorts Collection 1917-1923 (Blu-ray)

Rating:
★ ★ ★ ★ ★

One of silent film's most respected and talented actors, Buster Keaton continues to entertain film viewers to this day. Containing all 32 of the legendary comedian's silent shorts in 2K restorations from newly scanned archival footage, newly rediscovered alternate version of 1922 comedy The Blacksmith with four minutes of previously unseen material, and alternate endings to other shorts.

Buy on Amazon:  $42.99

Monsters and Madmen (DVD)

Rating:
★ ★ ★ ★ ★

Boris Karloff strikes fear in his two most terrifying roles, The Haunted Strangler, Corridors of Blood. Features commentary by writer Tom Weaver and producers Alex and Richard Gordon. Includes new interviews with cast and crew, production photos, stills galleries, original trailers, and booklets featuring Fangoria's 1984 interview with producer John Croydon and Boris Karloff.

Buy on Amazon:  $58.99

British Noir: Five Film Collection (DVD)

Rating:
★ ★ ★ ★ ★

Postwar cynicism and shadowy thrillers were as rife in Britain as they were in America. This five film collection from Rank Studios consists of classic British noir They Met in the Dark, The October Man, Snowbound, The Golden Salamander, and The Assassin. The films shed an appropriately dark light on social issues of the day.

Buy on Amazon:  $22.38

The First Films of Akira Kurosawa (DVD)

Rating:
★ ★ ★ ★ ★

Offering a two-part martial arts saga, a gripping portrait of female volunteers helping the war effort and a kabuki-inspired tale of deception. The early works of famed director Akira Kurosawa follow the war years in a rare look at his budding talent. Released in Japanese featuring English subtitles.

Buy on Amazon:  $44.49
